channel.title: Donator Problem
channel.description:
[b]Every Time I Make My Self Donator And Trade The Donator Shop It Still Says : You need to be donator
Any One Know How To Fix This Or Edit The Shop FOr It Not To Be Donator ??[/b]

item.title: Donator Problem
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Example:

]} else if (NPCID == ### && donator >= 1) { // donator >= 1) { means it's true that the player is a donator PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = ##; // shop ID? }

I’m probably going to contradict myself here but, I don’t generally understand why would you use an integer for a value that can only contain the values of true or false? Another way I would probably use over the above example, is you could possibly do this you could declare a boolean in the player’s object I’d generally name the field something simple like “donor” or donator, then when the player goes to load the shop check if the player has the rights of a donator.

Simple enough, yes?

Read full topic

item.title: Donator Problem
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

I did read carefully, he said: “Any One Know How To Fix This Or Edit The Shop” so I gave a potential fix - since he said he made himself a donator and still couldn’t use the shop, that means he didn’t do it correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Donator Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“rova1, post:3, topic:378827”]On some servers it has a character token (e.g. donator = 0) and you change it to 1.
Some have a seperate text file (e.g. donators.txt) located in the config folder (or wherever you mute & ban lists are) and you just add the name to that document on a new line for each name[/quote]
rova. he said how to edit the shop. not the donator status. read more careful

Read full topic

item.title: Donator Problem
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

On some servers it has a character token (e.g. donator = 0) and you change it to 1.
Some have a seperate text file (e.g. donators.txt) located in the config folder (or wherever you mute & ban lists are) and you just add the name to that document on a new line for each name

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

i don’t know for sure. but i think if you go in your client.java folder and search the npc you should be able to edit what you need to access if its wrong.
